intro: Plagiopetalum esquirolii var. septemnervium, commonly known as the seven-veined plagiopetalum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its palmate leaves with seven distinct veins, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to specific regions in Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
